summary_comment: Professor Hougland delivers lectures at a rapid pace with minimal explanation, making it difficult for students to grasp the material. She is reportedly unhelpful for students seeking additional support, especially those in the SLDS program, and has been described as rude in such interactions. The course culminates in a large project involving interviews and is heavily exam-based, leading many to advise against taking her class.
summary_comment_short: Professor Hougland delivers lectures at a fast pace with minimal explanation, making it difficult for students to grasp the material. Her approach to student support, particularly for those in SLDS, is reportedly unsatisfactory, and she has been described as rude in these interactions.

Ratings.comment: She's not great at helping those in SLDS, was actually quite rude when speaking about the need for it. Zooms through the material without much explanation. Huge project at the end that involves interviews and is mainly exam-based. Do not take it, it's not worth it.

summary_comment: Professor Sevich is highly regarded for her positive and caring approach, making complex anatomical content more manageable. She offers multiple ways to improve grades beyond traditional exams, fostering a supportive learning environment. Her humor and understanding contribute significantly to her overall high teaching quality.
summary_comment_short: Professor Sevich is highly regarded for her positive and supportive teaching approach, making even challenging anatomy content more manageable. Her engaging and humorous demeanor, combined with flexible grading opportunities, contribute to an excellent learning experience.

Ratings.comment: Victoria is an absolute angel.  The content can get a bit difficult at times (as is the nature of any anatomy course), but she gives you plenty of opportunities to gain points outside of the exams and boost your grade if needed.  She is positive, caring, funny, and understanding, and I would recommend her in a heartbeat.

summary_comment: Professor Lundine is highly regarded for her brilliance, passion, and engaging teaching style, making the course both enjoyable and educational without being overly burdensome in terms of workload. Her dedication to her subject matter and students is evident through her detailed explanations, open communication, and willingness to address questions, contributing to a positive learning environment. Students consistently recommend her classes due to their effectiveness and overall positive experience.
summary_comment_short: Professor Lundine is highly regarded for her brilliance, passion, and engaging teaching style, making the course both enjoyable and informative without being overly workload-intensive. Students consistently praise her approachability, genuine interest in student feedback, and ability to maintain high levels of engagement throughout the course.

Ratings.comment: Dr. Lundine is brilliant, kind, and passionate about the subject matter she teaches. Not a work heavy course, but very engaging and easy to learn a lot.

She is amazing!! She loves what she teaches and keeps the class interested. She reads the slideshows so attendance isn't necessary but I think it helped because she would explain topics in more detail and give examples. You have weekly quizzes, discussion posts, and one group project. It was an awesome class and I would take it again.
Great professor overall. Lectures were long and there was lots of note taking but it was interesting and she always answered any questions I had

She gives interesting and interactive lectures, is super open to questions, and genuinely cares about student feedback. Having her as a professor was a great experience. Course content included: weekly discussion posts, module quizzes, and one group project + presentation.

Dr. Lundine is one of my favorite professors at OSU! The class was relatively straightforward with 3 exams and a couple written assignments, and Dr. Lundine is very approachable if you have any questions. Not only is she at the top of her field, but she enjoys teaching and welcomes student discussion/feedback. 10/10 recommend taking her class!
